Pages.Name: light_environment
Pages.Description:
Sets the color and angle of the light from the sun and sky.

Typical setup:
1. Create an env_sky entity to use as your skybox
2. Create a light_environment entity and set Sky IBL Source to the name of the env_sky entity
3. Right-click on your light_environment entity and select 'Selected environment light -> Estimate lighting from HDR skybox'
4. Adjust angle and brightness of the sunlight as you see fit

Properties.Description: Distance range for light. 0=infinite
Whether this light casts shadow
Priority for the lights shadowmap
If disabled, direct lighting will not render into cubemaps. Not that this only works when Direct Lighting Type is set to Stationary or Dynamic.

Set a custom pattern of light brightness for this light. Pattern format is a string of characters, where 'a' is total darkness, 'z' fully bright. i.e. 'aaggnnttzz' would be a steppy fade in from dark to light.
Uses a flat color for the sky lighting. Can be a good starting point but you can get much higher quality lighting by using an IBL/env_sky.
Scales the intensity of the Simple Sky Color.

Here you can assign any env_sky entity for sky lighting. env_sky supports HDR/EXR high dynamic range lat-long/h-cross/v-cross skybox images is recommended for sky lighting for the best quality results. If you want to use a custom env_sky that is explicitly for sky lighting, you can use an env_sky with 'Start Disabled'.
Scale value for IBL intensity fine-tuning
This is the color of the virtual ground plane used for skybox IBL / color ambient lighting
Scale brightness by this amount, used for scripting direct light behaviour. NOTE: Only works on lights with Direct Lighting type set to Dynamic or Stationary.
Defines the shadow softness. Higher numbers produce more diffuse/softer shadows. 1 is a good starting value.
How direct lighting should be represented
Allows mixed dynamic cascade shadow maps with Baked shadows.
Allows SST generation for this (sun) light.
USE WITH CAUTION: Artificially softens direct specular (not cubemaps) to simulate cheap, soft area lights. Note: Direct Lighting must be set to Stationary or Dynamic for this to have an effect.
Relative to origin of the light_environment.
Relative to origin of the light_environment.
Relative to origin of the light_environment.
Relative to origin of the light_environment.
Softness of Imaginary Shadowing Light.
Softness of Imaginary Shadowing Light.
Softness of Imaginary Shadowing Light.
Softness of Imaginary Shadowing Light.
Relative Strength of Imaginary Shadowing Light.
Relative Strength of Imaginary Shadowing Light.
Relative Strength of Imaginary Shadowing Light.
Relative Strength of Imaginary Shadowing Light.
Relative Strength of Ambient/Unshadowed term. Lower values make darker shadows.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParent
InputOutputs.Description: Changes the entity's parent in the movement hierarchy.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachment
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on its parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment.

InputOutputs.Name: SetParentAttachmentMaintainOffset
InputOutputs.Description: Change this entity to attach to a specific attachment point on it's parent. Entities must be parented before being sent this input. The parameter passed in should be the name of the attachment. The entity will maintain it's position relative to the parent at the time it is attached.

InputOutputs.Name: ClearParent
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the the movement hierarchy, leaving it free to move independently.

InputOutputs.Name: Kill
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: KillHierarchy
InputOutputs.Description: Removes this entity and all its children from the world.

InputOutputs.Name: AddOutput
InputOutputs.Description: Adds an entity I/O connection to this entity. Parameter format: outputname>targetname>inputname>parameter>delay>max times to fire (-1 == infinite). Very dangerous, use with care.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser1 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser2 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser3 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: FireUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Causes this entity's OnUser4 output to be fired.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser1
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser1 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser2
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser2 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser3
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser3 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnUser4
InputOutputs.Description: Fired in response to FireUser4 input.

InputOutputs.Name: OnKilled
InputOutputs.Description: Fired when the entity is killed and removed from the game.

InputOutputs.Name: SetLightEnabled
InputOutputs.Description: Sets whether the light is enabled (takes parameter of 0 or 1)

InputOutputs.Name: TurnOn
InputOutputs.Description: Turn the light on.

InputOutputs.Name: TurnOff
InputOutputs.Description: Turn the light off.

InputOutputs.Name: Toggle
InputOutputs.Description: Toggle the light on/off.

InputOutputs.Name: SetLightColor
InputOutputs.Description: Set light color

InputOutputs.Name: SetLightBrightness
InputOutputs.Description: Set light brightness

InputOutputs.Name: SetAppearance
InputOutputs.Description: Set appearance 0=Normal 1=Flicker A, 2=Slow, strong pulse 3=Candle A ...

InputOutputs.Name: SetCustomAppearance
InputOutputs.Description: Set a custom pattern of light brightness for this light. Pattern format is a string of characters, where 'a' is total darkness, 'z' fully bright. i.e. 'aaggnnttzz' would be a steppy fade in from dark to light.

Pages.Name: light_environment
Pages.Description:
Sets the color and angle of the light from the sun and sky.

Typical setup:
1. Create an env_sky entity to use as your skybox
2. Create a light_environment entity and set Sky IBL Source to the name of the env_sky entity
3. Right-click on your light_environment entity and select 'Selected environment light -> Estimate lighting from HDR skybox'
4. Adjust angle and brightness of the sunlight as you see fit

Properties.Description: How indirect lighting should be represented
Distance range for light. 0=infinite
Whether this light casts shadow
Distance for near clip plane for shadow map

Set a custom pattern of light brightness for this light. Pattern format is a string of characters, where 'a' is total darkness, 'z' fully bright. i.e. 'aaggnnttzz' would be a steppy fade in from dark to light.
Distance at which the light starts to fade (<0 = use fademaxdist).
Maximum distance at which the light is visible (0 = don't fade out).
If true, this geometry renders into baked cube maps
When the number of visible lights exceeds the rendering budget, higher priority lights are chosen for rendering first.
Semicolon-delimited list of light groups to affect
The angular extent of the sun for casting soft shadows. Higher numbers are more diffuse. 1 is a good starting value.
Number of shadow cascades to use.
env_sky entity, lat-long/h-cross/v-cross skybox image, or sky material to use for sky IBL
Scale value for IBL intensity fine-tuning
Brightness beyond which pixels in the Sky IBL Source are considered to be coming from the sun
How direct lighting should be represented
Overrides how much the light affects the fog (if enabled)
How should light interact with volumetric fogging
Allows direct light to be indexed if baked. Indexed lights have per-pixel quality specular lighting and normal map response
